name: Export It 1.0.1
subline: ExpressionEngine Data Export and REST Api Server

sections.title: About Export It
sections.content:
The goal of Export It is to allow ExpressionEngine developers the ability to take their data out of ExpressionEngine. Export It does this through 2 unique tools; the CP module and the REST API.

First, there's a complete Control Panel module, which allows for export of members, channel entries, mailing lists and comments. You have a variety of export formats available depending on which type of data you're trying to export which are JSON, XML, ExpressionEngine Member XML, Disqus XML Excel TSV files.

The other side is the REST API. The REST API allows commmon HTTP REST requests to be performed against your ExpressionEngine site to return data in either JSON or XML formats. The REST API works against channel entries, mailing lists, comments and members. Future updates will include Category, Forum and others. (If you'd like your add-on to have methods please let me know.)

sections.title: Installation
sections.content:
To install Export It you follow the same steps as any other ExpressionEngine add-on:

  1. Unzip the download
  2. Upload the extracted folder to your ExpressionEngine third party folder usually located at:
    /system/expressionengine/third_party/
  3. Navigate to your Add-Ons management page and choose Modules
  4. Select Export It from the list and click install.

Note that Export It requires an encryption key be set in your config.php file.

sections.title: Control Panel Export
sections.content:
Member Export

Export It allows for the export of Members by either Group or all. You can add additional info to the export like the custom fields or even a complete export (minus some items due to security). You can export as either Excel, XML, JSON or ExpressionEngine XML format.

Channel Entries Export

You can export your Channel Entries into either XML or JSON formats only. To export select your channel, the date range and the format you want to export to.

Comment Export

Export the comments as either XML, JSON or Disqus XML. You can export by channel, date range and status.

Mailing List Export

You can export mailing lists by either individual list or a combined export. If you'd like to remove duplicates you can. Export can be done as either Excel, XML or JSON.

sections.title: REST Server API
sections.content:
The Export It REST Server allows you to make REST requests against your ExpressionEngine site and return data in either the XML or JSON format. Note that in order to use the REST API it must first be enabled within the Export It Settings module.

At a minimum, all REST requests must include a unqiue API key and an explicit format of either JSON or XML. User/Member authentication is planned for a future release. You can get the primary URL to use for your API from the Export It Settings page.

Error Codes and Responses

Currently, the Export It API will return errors through HTTP Status Codes and a wrapped response. Note that at this time the API responds true even when no results are found. The Error Codes are planned to be expanded on with future updates.

200 = Ok
500 = Failure

get_members

Returns a list of members

Resource URL
http://example.com/?ACT=<ACT>&key=<key>&method=get_members&format=xml

Parameters

group_id
optional		 The user group you want to limit against
include_custom_fields
optional		 Whether you want to include the custom fields with the return
complete_select
optional		 Should the return include most data fields?

Example Request
http://example.com/?ACT=<ACT>&key=<key>&method=get_members&format=json&group_id=5&complete_select=1

get_member

Returns a specific member

Resource URL
http://example.com/?ACT=<ACT>&key=<key>&method=get_member&format=xml

Parameters
A member_id must be provided

member_id
required		 The member you would like to return
include_custom_fields
optional		 Whether you want to include the custom fields with the return
complete_select
optional		 Should the return include most data fields?

 

Example Request
http://example.com/?ACT=<ACT>&key=<key>&method=get_member&format=json&member_id=2

get_channel_entries

Returns the entries for the given channel_id

Resource URL
http://example.com/?ACT=<ACT>&key=<key>&method=get_channel_entries&channel_id=<channel_id>&format=xml

Parameters
A channel_id must be provided

channel_id
required		 The channel you'd like to return entries from
date_range
optional		 The amount of days you'd like the query to be contrained to

Example Request
http://example.com/?ACT=<ACT>&key=<key>&method=get_channel_entries&channel_id=12&format=xml

get_channel_entry

Returns a specific channel entry

Resource URL
http://example.com/?ACT=<ACT>&key=<key>&method=get_channel_entry&format=xml

Parameters
A entry_id or url_title must be provided

entry_id
optional		 The id of the entry you would like to return
url_title
optional		 The url_title of the entry you would like to return

Example Request
http://example.com/?ACT=<ACT>&key=<key>&method=get_channel_entry&entry_id=2354&format=json

get_comments

Returns a comments for the given parameters

Resource URL
http://example.com/?ACT=<ACT>&key=<key>&method=get_comments&format=xml&channel_id=2

Parameters
A entry_id or channel_id must be provided

entry_id
optional		 The id of the entry you would like to return comments from
channel_id
optional		 The id for the channel you would like to return comments from
date_range
optional		 The amount of days you would like to restrain comments for
status
optional		 The status for the comment you would like to return

Example Request
http://example.com/?ACT=<ACT>&key=<key>&method=get_comments&entry_id=74&format=json

get_comment

Returns a specific comment for the given id

Resource URL
http://example.com/?ACT=<ACT>&key=<key>&method=get_comment&format=xml&comment_id=573

Parameters
A comment_id must be provided

comment_id
required		 The primary key of the comment you want to return

 

Example Request
http://example.com/?ACT=<ACT>&key=<key>&method=get_comment&comment_id=5734&format=json

get_mailing_list

Returns a specific comment for the given id

Resource URL
http://example.com/?ACT=<ACT>&key=<key>&method=get_mailing_list&format=xml&comment_id=573

Parameters

list_id
optional		 The list you want to return subscribers from
exclude_duplicates
optional		 Whether duplicates should be removed from the export

Example Request
http://example.com/?ACT=<ACT>&key=<key>&method=get_mailing_list&list_id=2&format=json

get_category

Returns a specific category for the given id

Resource URL
http://example.com/?ACT=<ACT>&key=<key>&method=get_category&format=xml&cat_id=12

Parameters
A cat_id is required

cat_id
required		 The list you want to return subscribers from
exclude_duplicates
optional		 Whether duplicates should be removed from the export

Example Request
http://example.com/?ACT=<ACT>&key=<key>&method=get_category&cat_id=2&format=json&exclude_duplicates=1

get_category_posts

Returns the entry ids for a given category id

Resource URL
http://example.com/?ACT=<ACT>&key=<key>&method=get_category_posts&format=xml&cat_id=12

Parameters
A cat_id is required

cat_id
required		 The category you want to return the entries to.

Example Request
http://example.com/?ACT=<ACT>&key=<key>&method=get_category_posts&cat_id=12&format=json

get_categories

Returns the categories for a given entry id

Resource URL
http://example.com/?ACT=<ACT>&key=<key>&method=get_categories&format=xml&entry_id=32

Parameters
A entry_id is required

entry_id
required		 The entry you want to return the categories from.

Example Request
http://example.com/?ACT=<ACT>&key=<key>&method=get_categories&entry_id=32&format=json

check_credentials

Verifies if the given username and password are valid credentials for the system.

Resource URL
http://example.com/?ACT=<ACT>&key=<key>&method=check_credentials&format=xml

Parameters
A entry_id is required

username
required		 The value to use for the username check.
password
required		 The value to use for the password check.

Example Request
http://example.com/?ACT=<ACT>&key=<key>&method=check_credentials&format=json&username=test&password=test_pass

sections.title: Configuration
sections.content:
Enable API

The API has to be manually enabled for security. Once enabled though, you can start making API requests.

API Key

An API key is required for security. Any request to your API without an API key will be rejected. It should be a random string no more than 32 characters long.

License Number

You can get your license number from your Devot:ee member page under Past Purchases. Use that code here.

sections.title: Developers
sections.content:
Requirements

Export It requires ExpressionEngine 2.x

Export It requires an encryption key be set in your config.php file.
